page.title: 14SERVICES
page.content: In Sturminster we have a medium size Fire Station which was built in 1946. There are 11 firemen,4 leading firemen,1 sub. officer and 1 station officer.The firemen are volunteers and have part-time jobs, such as a carpenter,postman and a dairyhand.They have drill on Thursday evenings at the station and sometimes they practise at Shephards Warehouse on the Industrial Estate.They have 2 appliances and 1 Landrover.The appliances are Bedford TK's.The station has a licensed bar,a full-sized snooker table,a television and 2 dartboards. The Ambulance Station closed down in 1980/81.This caused the loss of about 13 jobs.The Station had 3 Ambulances which covered Sturminster and its surrounding villages.The nearest General Hospital at Yeovil.The Ambulances now come from Blandford.
